questions.question: Would you rather ……………………. here or go home?
questions.description: Would rather is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I would rather you …………………………. now.
questions.description: To say that you would prefer someone to do something, we use a past tense after would rather.

questions.question: I decided to phone rather than …………………………
questions.description: When the main clause has a to-infinitive, rather than is usually followed by an infinitive without to. Ing forms are also possible.

questions.question: She took her child with ………………………..
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is unusual after a preposition of place.

questions.question: Would you mind if I ………………………… the window?
questions.description: A past tense is used after would you mind.

questions.question: Would you mind if I ……………………….. late?
Do you mind if I ………………………. music?
questions.description: A present tense is used after do you mind.

questions.question: Do you mind people ……………………….. in your room?
Would you mind ………………………… people smoked in your house?
A new ………………………….. of communication was developed in the 19th century.
questions.description: Means is always used in the plural form.

questions.question: I wouldn’t mind ……………………….. this again.
questions.description: An ing form is used in this structure.

questions.question: I hope ………………………… them soon.
questions.description: An infinitive is used after I hope.
